fu.search

Class TextHashtable<T>

  • java.lang.Object
    • fu.search.TextHashtable<T>

  • public class TextHashtable<T>
extends java.lang.Object
    A kind of hashtable where a key is a text string. The table support fuzzy lookup, e.g. for a prefix strings.

    • Field Summary

        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • SEARCH_SPLIT_PREFIXES

        public static final int SEARCH_SPLIT_PREFIXES
        For "Hello World" also stores "H", "He", "Hel", "Hell", "Hell", "W", "Wo", "Wor", "Worl".
        Note: This option also implicitly sets SEARCH_SPLITS, thus also "Hello", "World" are stored.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • SEARCH_2SPLITS

        public static final int SEARCH_2SPLITS
        For "Hello World how are you" also stores "World how", "how are", "are you".
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • SEARCH_2SPLITS_PREFIXES

        public static final int SEARCH_2SPLITS_PREFIXES
        For "Hello World how are you" also stores "W", "Wo", "Wor" ..."World ho", "h", "ho", "how"..."how ar", "a", "ar"..."are yo".
        Note: This option also implicitly sets SEARCH_2SPLITS, thus also "World how are you", "how are you", "are you", "you" are stored.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

    • Constructor Detail

      • TextHashtable

        public TextHashtable(TextSimplifier simplifier,
             int searchFlags)
        Creates a text hashtable. Default values for prefix and metaphone search are used.
        Parameters:
        simplifier - a text simplifier that simplifies all search strings before looking them up (can be null for no simplification)
        searchFlags - which variation of the word can be searched

      • TextHashtable

        public TextHashtable(TextSimplifier simplifier,
             int searchFlags,
             int prefixSearchMinimum,
             int dmetaphoneSearchMinimum)
        Creates a text hashtable.
        Parameters:
        simplifier - a text simplifier that simplifies all search strings before looking them up (can be null for no simplification)
        searchFlags - which variation of the word can be searched
        prefixSearchMinimum - only considered if prefix search is allowed. A search string must have at least this number of characters for a lookup the prefix. 1 means: even a single char can be looked up (requires a huge amount of memory).
        dmetaphoneSearchMinimum - configuring the dmetaphone search (only read, if dmetaphone search is allowed). A search string must have at least this number of characters for a lookup. 1 means: even a single char can be looked up (requires a huge amount of memory).

      • TextHashtable

        public TextHashtable(TextSimplifier simplifier,
             int searchFlags,
             int prefixSearchMinimum,
             int prefixSearchThresholdLowGranularity,
             int prefixSearchLowGranularityValue,
             int dmetaphoneSearchMinimum)
        Creates a text hashtable.
        Parameters:
        simplifier - a text simplifier that simplifies all search strings before looking them up (can be null for no simplification)
        searchFlags - which variation of the word can be searched
        prefixSearchMinimum - only considered if prefix search is allowed. A search string must have at least this number of characters for a lookup the prefix. 1 means: even a single char can be looked up (requires a huge amount of memory).
        prefixSearchThresholdLowGranularity - only considered if prefix search is allowed. If a prefix exceeds this number, it is only stored for prefix look up if it matches a multiply of granularity
        prefixSearchLowGranularityValue - only considered if prefix search is allowed. The granularity of the prefix look up for larger strings
        dmetaphoneSearchMinimum - configuring the dmetaphone search (only read, if dmetaphone search is allowed). A search string must have at least this number of characters for a lookup. 1 means: even a single char can be looked up (requires a huge amount of memory). The prefix look up table is used to look up hits, if only a prefix is given. E.g. if the text "Hello" is stored, it is returned if only "He" is given. Three parameters can control the prefix look up:
        • prefixSearchMinimum: e.g. for 3, "H" and "He" do not return "Hello", but "Hel" and "Hell"
        • prefixSearchThresholdLowGranularity, prefixSearchLowGranularityValue: E.g. for (5,2) and the Text "HelloABCDEF", the prefixes "Hello", "HelloAB" and "HelloABCD" are stored. Prefixes that do not match these steps are cut, e.g. "HelloABC" is first mapped to "HelloAB" for prefix look up. This espially means that also e.g. "HelloABX" and "HelloABY" are hits for "HelloABCDEF"

      • get

        public java.util.ArrayList<SearchHit<T>> get(java.lang.String searchString)
        Return hits, that match the configured search. The results are ordered (best hit first).

      • get

                                    boolean debug)
        Return hits, that match the configured search. The results are ordered (best hit first).

      • get

        public java.util.ArrayList<SearchHit<T>> get(java.lang.String searchString,
                                    int maxValues)
        Return hits, that match the configured search. The results are ordered (best hit first). The result is limited by the given number of results.

      • get

        public java.util.ArrayList<SearchHit<T>> get(java.lang.String searchString,
                                    int maxValues,
                                    boolean debug)
        Return hits, that match the configured search. The results are ordered (best hit first). The result is limited by the given number of results.

        Reduces the inner containers to the actual sizes to safe memory.
